definition: water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
(lit.) to splash dirty water/(fig.) to throw mud at/to smear (sb)

sentences.english: Don't throw the slops in the yard.
Some factories send dirty water into lakes and rivers.
sentences.chinese: 一些工厂把脏水排到了湖里和河里。

sentences.english: One is to make the powder so that you can't mix it with dirty water.
sentences.chinese: 一个就是制作出使人不能和脏水混合的奶粉。

sentences.english: As he reached the door, he was showered straight on the head with a basin of slops.
sentences.chinese: 他走到门口劈头泼来一盆脏水。

sentences.english: Just then a basin of dirty water poured over his head .
sentences.chinese: 就在这时，一盆脏水从上面泼到了他的头上。

sentences.english: Well, you bring the world the purity of music, the world has thrown you a water.
sentences.chinese: 你带给世界那么纯净的音乐，世界却泼你一身脏水。

sentences.english: Rose:You mean that I have to put half of my body in the dirty flood water?
sentences.chinese: 你是说我需要把下半生浸在这样的脏水里？

sentences.english: There are other dangers lurking in muddy water and animal feces.
sentences.chinese: 在脏水和动物粪便中还有其他潜在危险。

sentences.english: The workers are unblocking the sewer to prevent the leakage of dirty water.
sentences.chinese: 工人们正在疏通下水管道，防止脏水外泄。

sentences.english: The kitchen sink was full nearly to the brim with filthy greenish water.
sentences.chinese: 厨房里的水池几乎满得溢了出来，尽是发绿的脏水。

sentences.english: The slops she threw down sprinkled me all over.
sentences.chinese: 她泼下来的脏水全都洒在了我的身上。

sentences.english: He tipped the slops out of the pail.
If you have dirt on your boss, your boss can take you out.
sentences.chinese: 如果你给老板泼脏水，老板就能赶走你。

sentences.english: Our regime is the leak, the Muslims the water.
sentences.chinese: 我们的制度就是漏洞，穆斯林就是脏水。

sentences.english: Don't pull out the dirty water before you have clean.
sentences.chinese: 在没有干净水前，不要把脏水倒掉。

sentences.english: The utility model relates to a water-saving article washing frame through which filthy water is changed into clear water.
sentences.chinese: 本实用新型涉及一种将脏水转变为清水的节水洗物架。

definition: (lit.) to splash dirty water/(fig.) to throw mud at/to smear (sb)
human excrement/night soil (human manure traditionally used as agricultural fertilizer)
to clean the floor/(Internet slang) (lit.) to wash (the blood) off the floor/(fig.) to cover up evidence of sb's wrongdoing/to defend (a wrongdoer)/(coll.) to carpet-bomb
to discredit/to defame/to smear sb's name/to bring shame upon (oneself or one's family etc)/to blacken (e.g. commando's face for camouflage)/to black out or obliterate (e.g. censored words)
